SafetyInspectionBy: Michigan LARA, Bureau of Fire Services

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunoco Logistics Owosso Terminal is a refined petroleum product distributor. The Owosso Terminal is an onshore, light products, bulk petroleum storage terminal used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Owosso, MI. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded Gasoline, low-sulfur diesel, No. 2 fuel oil, Butane, Ethanol, and various other petroleum based additives.



The Owosso Terminal was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes.  The Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the associated piping, pump and a 60,000 gallon (water capacity) storage vessel that contain Butane.



Sunoco Logistics Owosso Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.  



In the event of an emergency involving the Owosso Terminal, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Owosso Fire Department and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with fire department and the Shiawassee County LEPC.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, the Sunoco Logistics Owosso Terminal looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, the Owosso Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
